snippet: Bollinger Shipyards, which was hired to retrofit patrol boats, agreed to pay to the government $8.5 million. The boat had to be abandoned.
abstract: Louisiana's Bollinger Shipyards will pay federal government $8.5 million to settle claims that it concealed serious flaws on ships it retrofitted for Coast Guard; settlement follows decade-long legal battle.
lead_paragraph: Bollinger Shipyards, which was hired to retrofit patrol boats, agreed to pay to the government $8.5 million. The boat had to be abandoned.

headline.main: Shipyard Accused of Botching Coast Guard Repairs Settles Case
headline.print_headline: Shipyard Settles Case Over Botched Repairs
